basics.label: PhD Candidate in Statistics
basics.summary: Doctoral candidate at Texas A&M University specializing in Bayesian non-parametric and semi-parametric inference. My research focuses on developing robust methods for modern data challenges, including semi-supervised learning, causal inference, and transfer learning.

work.name: Texas A&M University
work.summary: Assisted in teaching various undergraduate and graduate level statistics courses.

work.name: Penn State University
work.summary: Served as the primary instructor for MATH 22.

volunteer.summary: Led the Statistics Graduate Student Association (SGSA), organizing events and representing graduate student interests.
Participated in the search and selection process for the new department head.

publications.name: Bayesian semi-supervised inference via a debiased modeling approach
publications.summary: Co-authored with Abhishek Chakrabortty and Anirban Bhattacharya. Winner of the ASA Section on Bayesian Statistical Science (SBSS) 2024 Student Paper Award.

publications.name: Bayesian semi-parametric causal inference: Targeted doubly robust estimation of treatment effects
